website_summaries.verdict: If you have a lot of land to mow and want to make it as easy as possible, you won't regret choosing this mower. Though it's costly, you get exceptional quality and performance for the price.
pros: A powerful yard machine with few complaints
It's fairly easy to maneuver once you get used to it, and combines a 61-inch cutting deck with a 27-horsepower Briggs and Stratton V-twin motor for a clean, beautiful cut every time
cons: It's expensive, and if you want the compatible bagger you will have to spend even more
It's also difficult to avoid making skid marks in the yard until you master the control mechanisms

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mower on line for my 64 year old mom and her property. So easy to do, price was good they dropped it in front yard. It does come in a crate and my husband did struggle a little breaking the crate apart but he has mowed 6 acres in 4 hours which normally take 8 to 10 hours. This mower was a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: S.C.

customer_reviews.title: Great zero turn mower
customer_reviews.text: Great mower had it 6 months no Problems works really well.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Tryhane

customer_reviews.title: A bit too easy to create skid marks in the yard when making ...
customer_reviews.text: Have used three times. Everything is working well. Takes a while to master steering and speed control. Would have appreciated having a break pedal. A bit too easy to create skid marks in the yard when making a tight turn.
customer_reviews.author: anthony j waylonis

customer_reviews.title: Worst package ever!!!!
customer_reviews.text: If I could give it less then 1 I would. Husqvarna put a 27 hp Briggs & Stratton engine on their mower. Then they assume no responsibility. This is the worst mower engine i've ever had. So many problems. DON'T I REPEAT DON'T BUY HUSQVARNA OR BRIGGS &STRATTON!
customer_reviews.author: Gene Medders

customer_reviews.title: I bought this mower 4 years ago to mow 2 ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mower 4 years ago to mow 2 acres this machine gets the job done period !!!! I also bought the power bagger for another 1000k that system will pickup every twig or acorn on the ground if you want it to. I have 55 trees I cut around and it also handles a ton of leaves in the fall as well .
customer_reviews.author: kelly collins

customer_reviews.title: No Suspension
customer_reviews.text: The mower gives a good cut BUT the mower has no suspension so if your lawn is not pool table smooth and you are turning as careful as you can be.one of the rear wheels will spin and tear up a chunk of lawn.My lawn is destroyed from this mower its for sale next spring
customer_reviews.author: jerry b.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent low maintenance zero turn mower.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a Husqvarna MZ61 61 in. 30 horse power engine. The mower is the second one I have had and is six years old. I mow 10 acres of bahia grass which is very tough with no effort. My neighbor who owns a lawn maintenance business has used it on many occasions when his equipment was down. I have nothing but praise for this equipment. One Spindle replaced, belts, and blades is about all the repairs required over six years. Oil changes lube jobs air filter and oil filters for routine maintenance. Hope the new one with a 27 horse power engine works as well.
customer_reviews.author: George L Hudspeth

customer_reviews.title: Beast of a mower.
customer_reviews.text: 200 hours in and so far no issues. Runs great. Has plenty of power. Changed to copperhead blades and it made a big difference in deck discharge. Stripes beautifully. Only complaint would be the parking break switch. Sometimes it doesn’t engage.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Beast of a mower!
customer_reviews.text: I have 20 hours on my husky. Absolute beast of a mower. I've cut things that normally would require a bush hog. Never killed it, bogged it once. Top quality construction, commercial quality. A sure buy.
customer_reviews.author: I love that game

customer_reviews.title: What quality control?
customer_reviews.text: I wish I never bought the Husqvarna MZT 61. I've had things go wrong that are obvious factory defects and a lack of quality control. On the first day one of the blades fell off. Since then I find bolts and parts on the ground and don't know where they belong. Yesterday another blade fell off and then later the belt to the pulleys became jammed. The seat sensor went bad and it wouldn't start. Maybe I got a lemon but you guessed it it's just out of warranty. I've had nothing but trouble with this mower. Wish I looked at competing brands better.
customer_reviews.author: G Cee

product_meta.title: Husqvarna MZ61 61 in. 27 HP Briggs & Stratton Hydrostatic Zero Turn Riding Mower
product_meta.description: The MZ61 zero-turn mower from Husqvarna takes performance, productivity and comfort to a whole new level. The intuitive operator interface, heavy-duty steel frame and commercial rated hydraulic system create the ultimate mowing experience. With a rugged fabricated steel deck that is mulch and collection capable, the MZ is practical for all of your property maintenance needs. The high back seat with armrests and adjustable ergonomic steering levers will provide a comfortable ride time after time.
feature_bullets: Husqvarna 61 in. zero-turn lawn mower from the MZ series delivers commercial-grade power and amazing ergonomics
27 HP Briggs Endurance engine provides reliable startups and high ground speeds
Fabricated 11-gauge steel cutting deck offers an excellent 54 in. cut with an ergonomically designed deck lifting system for quick and easy adjustments from the operator’s seat
Clippings can be discharged, mulched or bagged with a 9-bushel triple bag collection system (mulching kit and bagger attachment sold separately)
High-back seat with armrests, foam-padded hand grips and vibration dampeners make mowing comfortable for hours on end

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars14 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
